hanzi-su-wiki:
営

Значения

Заниматься, вести (дела); совершать, производить

Мнемоника

Сокращено. Точки — сигнальные огни. Ниже — стены 冖 и сторожевое помещение, соединённое с залом. Поддерживать порядок на военном форте или строить его.

Варианты

營, 营
purpleculture_pinyin:
yíng
Japanese variant of 营
Японский вариант лагеря
rtega_mnemonic:
営営RSencampment, barracks, manage
  • place where mouths 呂 recite studied words 龸
heisig_constituent: occupation, schoolhouse, owl, crown, spine, mouth, drop, mouth2
koohiiStory1: The schoolhouse is the backbone of a foundation that will allow you to find a good occupation.
koohiiStory2: During the German occupation, this Nazi officer´s occupation was to manage schools that were requisitioned for training the children of the Aryan race to stand proud with an erect spine (mnemonic : "the occupation´s spine schools"). Kanji meanings : to manage, to conduct (business), and also "barracks; camp; encapment". This story should help avoid confusion with post (#824) and employ (#1083). The military occupation theme hints to the secondary meaning, e.g. 営倉 "detention barracks".
jp_example_words:
営む(いとなむ): to carry on (e.g. in ceremony), to run a business
運営(うんえい): management, administration, operation
営業(えいぎょう): business, trade, sales, operations
経営(けいえい): management, administration
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A Viking who knows how to use a bathtub will have to manage all the baths for the other Vikings. Vikings aren't so great with bathing... if you can get one Viking to figure it out he has to manage the rest of them.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture a Viking trying to manage his Viking friends so they'll use the bathtub properly. He has to manage which people go in when, how hot or cold the water is, and provide all the soap. It's a very important job.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The poor Viking trying to manage all the others keeps having to confiscate acorns (えい). "You can't take baths in acorns and wood, it has to be water!" he shouts.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Some of the Vikings managed to fill their bathtubs with acorns and are trying to rub themselves clean with them instead of water...
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the spine (呂) in the classroom (龸) is occupied

yíng
яп. вм. 营
Radicals: 呂  (bathtub, viking)
Meaning Mnemonic
A Viking who knows how to use a bathtub will have to manage all the baths for the other Vikings. Vikings aren't so great with bathing... if you can get one Viking to figure it out he has to manage the rest of them.
Picture a Viking trying to manage his Viking friends so they'll use the bathtub properly. He has to manage which people go in when, how hot or cold the water is, and provide all the soap. It's a very important job.
Reading Mnemonic
The poor Viking trying to manage all the others keeps having to confiscate acorns (えい). "You can't take baths in acorns and wood, it has to be water!" he shouts.
Some of the Vikings managed to fill their bathtubs with acorns and are trying to rub themselves clean with them instead of water...
